title: Alters prescription forms
summary: Provides that no prescription for a controlled substance shall be on a prescription form which authorizes any other drug or controlled substance; provides that the total number of drugs, which may not exceed three, included on a single prescription form shall be indicated in a box on such form; defines controlled substance.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to prescription forms

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  7  of  section 6810 of the education law, as
    2  amended by chapter 519 of the laws  of  2002,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    7.  (a)  No  prescription for a drug written in this state by a person
    5  authorized to issue such prescription shall be on  a  prescription  form
    6  which  authorizes  the  dispensing  or  compounding of any other drug OR
    7  CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF DRUGS, WHICH  MAY  NOT  EXCEED
    8  THREE,  INCLUDED  ON  A  SINGLE  FORM MUST BE INDICATED IN A BOX ON EACH
    9  FORM. No [drug] CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE shall be dispensed by a  pharmacist
   10  when such prescription form includes any other drug.
   11    (b)  [With  respect  to  drugs  other  than controlled substances, the
   12  provisions of this subdivision shall not apply to  pharmacists  employed
   13  by  or  providing  services under contract to general hospitals, nursing

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2286

TITLE OF BILL:
An act to amend the education law, in relation to prescription forms

PURPOSE:
This bill authorizes more than one non-controlled substance drug to be
recorded on a single prescription form as long as none are controlled
substances.

SUMMARY OF BILL:
Section one authorizes more than one non-controlled substance drug to be
recorded on a single prescription form; prohibits multiple prescriptions
if one is for a controlled substance; and requires that the total number
of prescriptions be recorded on the form.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
Chapter 620 of the Laws of 1991 removed the authority to record more
than one prescription on a single prescription form.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
